questions.question: Choose the correct second conditional:
choices: If I will see him, I tell him.
If I saw him, I would tell him.
If I see him, I would tell him.
If I had seen him, I would tell him.

questions.question: Complete (third conditional): "If you ____ (tell) me, I ____ (help) you." ____
answer: had told me, would have helped you
questions.explanation: 3rd cond.: had + pp / would have + pp.

questions.question: Which shows deduction in the present?
choices: He had to be at school.
He may had been at school.

questions.question: Paraphrase with a modal of obligation: "It’s necessary for you to submit by Friday."
answer: You have to submit by Friday.

questions.question: Zero conditional (general truth):
choices: If water will reach 100°C, it will boil.
If water reached 100°C, it would boil.
If water had reached 100°C, it would have boiled.
